name: Nortriptyline (Pamelor)
summary: A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) used to treat depression, certain types of chronic pain, and off-label for migraine prevention.
description: Nortriptyline is a secondary amine tricyclic antidepressant, the active metabolite of amitriptyline. It works primarily by inhibiting the reuptake of norepinephrine and, to a lesser extent, serotonin, thereby increasing their concentrations in the synaptic cleft. It has fewer sedative and anticholinergic effects than tertiary amine TCAs, making it better tolerated in some patients. In addition to depression, it is often used off-label for neuropathic pain, migraine prophylaxis, and insomnia associated with chronic pain.

contraindications: Concurrent use with MAOIs or within 14 days
Hypersensitivity to nortriptyline or other TCAs

sections.text: Inhibits norepinephrine and serotonin reuptake, increasing their synaptic concentrations; also has anticholinergic and antihistaminic effects.

adult.depression: Start 25 mg 3–4 times daily; usual range 75–150 mg/day, given in divided doses or as a single nightly dose
adult.neuropathic_pain: 10–25 mg nightly, titrated up as tolerated

sections.geriatric: Start at 10–25 mg/day and titrate slowly
sections.renal_impairment: No adjustment necessary, but use caution

sections.text: Antidepressant effects typically take 2–4 weeks; analgesic effects may occur sooner.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Caution in patients with cardiovascular disease
Avoid abrupt discontinuation to prevent withdrawal symptoms

items: ECG in older adults or those with cardiac risk

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; potential for neonatal withdrawal
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use caution

sections.text: Gradually reduce over several weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, headache, and malaise.

items: Often preferred over tertiary amine TCAs due to better tolerability
Can be useful for patients with depression and coexisting neuropathic pain

seo.title: Nortriptyline (Pamelor): TCA Antidepressant Uses and Information
seo.description: Nortriptyline (Pamelor) is a tricyclic antidepressant used for depression, neuropathic pain, and migraine prevention, with fewer side effects than amitriptyline.
